description:
During a server create when the ec2 metadata triggers the async creation of the network information for the server n-cpu times out waiting for the rpc response from n-net causing the server to go into an error state. See:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_54_32_139

Looking at the n-net logs for the same req-id show that n-net got the allocate network call at:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-net.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_53_11_153

and completed it successfully a little over a  1 min later at:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-net.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_54_32_681

and there is no other indication as to why n-cpu raised the timeout. The rabbit logs don't show an error around that time:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/rabbitmq/clarkbtest.txt.gz
(ignore the unusual path it's the rabbit log for that run)

My guess is that the timeout for that rpc call was 60sec and taking a little longer caused the timeout and this was just run on a slow node.

looking at logstash for:

message:"MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply to message" AND message:"ec2utils.get_ip_info_for_instance_from_nw_info" AND tags:"screen-n-cpu.txt"

only shows one hit in the past 7 days, so it's probably not super prolific.
title: n-cpu timeout on rpc allocating network

comments.content:
During a server create when the ec2 metadata triggers the async creation of the network information for the server n-cpu times out waiting for the rpc response from n-net causing the server to go into an error state. See:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_54_32_139

Looking at the n-net logs for the same req-id show that n-net got the allocate network call at:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-net.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_53_11_153

and completed it successfully a little over a  1 min later at:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/screen-n-net.txt.gz#_2014-09-19_17_54_32_681

and there is no other indication as to why n-cpu raised the timeout. The rabbit logs don't show an error around that time:

http://logs.openstack.org/27/122527/2/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full/0258bda/logs/rabbitmq/clarkbtest.txt.gz
(ignore the unusual path it's the rabbit log for that run)

My guess is that the timeout for that rpc call was 60sec and taking a little longer caused the timeout and this was just run on a slow node.

looking at logstash for:

message:"MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply to message" AND message:"ec2utils.get_ip_info_for_instance_from_nw_info" AND tags:"screen-n-cpu.txt"

only shows one hit in the past 7 days, so it's probably not super prolific.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~treinish

comments.content: I wonder if it's related to - https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1368989
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
I run into this very issue in my internal CI, once every 30 runs.  I am running master on a 8 cores VM. I use nova-network.

I am attaching the logs. The logs are currently online here : https://37.187.159.67:5443/job/cinder-sofs-validate/185/

Pb : the instance 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e goes into ERROR state.

Relevant stack trace

screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]   File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py", line 2836, in _create_image
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     content=files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=network_info)
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]   File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/api/metadata/base.py", line 159, in __init__
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     ec2utils.get_ip_info_for_instance_from_nw_info(network_info)
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]   File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/api/ec2/ec2utils.py", line 151, in get_ip_info_for_instance_from_nw_info
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     fixed_ips = nw_info.fixed_ips()
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]   File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/network/model.py", line 462, in _sync_wrapper
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz: 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     self.wait()
[...]
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz:2015-02-19 15:29:11.951 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     self._raise_timeout_exception(msg_id)
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz:2015-02-19 15:29:11.951 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py", line 212, in _raise_timeout_exception
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz:2015-02-19 15:29:11.951 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e]     _('Timed out waiting for a reply to message ID %s.') % msg_id)
screen-n-cpu.txt.gz:2015-02-19 15:29:11.951 19372 TRACE nova.compute.manager [instance: 50862b7e-ca5f-4224-b2dc-83ea43c6a55e] MessagingTimeout: Timed out waiting for a reply to message ID f04885c2e4114519ad80448dc5901b5b.



Logstash query : http://logstash.openstack.org/#

411 hits in the last 7 days. All in gate-rally-dsvm.

comments.content: Jogo, you sure you commented on the right bug report ? I don't see how https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150803/ could be related.

comments.content:
This is an automated cleanup. This bug report has been closed because it
is older than 18 months and there is no open code change to fix this.
After this time it is unlikely that the circumstances which lead to
the observed issue can be reproduced.

If you can reproduce the bug, please:
* reopen the bug report (set to status "New")
* AND add the detailed steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)
* AND leave a comment "CONFIRMED FOR: <RELEASE_NAME>"
  Only still supported release names are valid (LIBERTY, MITAKA, OCATA, NEWTON).
  Valid example: CONFIRMED FOR: LIBERTY
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
